===Noun===
{{ja-noun|てんこ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=てんこ|mythology|Shinto}}: A [[heavenly]]/[[celestial]] [[fox]]; a nine-tail fox said to be the most powerful form of the [[kitsune]]: Once they turn 1,000-years-old, they gain all nine of their tails, turn a golden color, and ascend to the [[heavens]], where they become celestial foxes.

====Coordinate terms====
* {{l|ja|善狐}} (''zenko'') "''[[good]] foxes''," sometimes simply called "''Inari-Foxes''"
* {{l|ja|野狐}} (''yako'', or also known as ''nogitsune'') wild fox
* {{l|ja|妖狐}} ({{l|ja|ようこ}}, ''yōko'') a "''[[demon]] fox''," (a kitsune)
* {{l|ja|九尾の狐}} ({{l|ja|きゅうびのきつね}}, ''kyūbi no kitsune'') a "''nine-tailed fox''"
* {{l|ja|九尾の妖狐}} ({{l|ja|きゅうびのようこ}}, ''kyūbi no yōko'') a "''nine-tailed demon fox''"
* {{l|ja|狐の嫁入り}} ({{l|ja|きつねのよめいり}}, ''kitsune no yomeiri'') rain shower while the sun shines
* {{l|ja|狐火}} ({{l|ja|きつねび}}, ''kitsunebi'') "[[will o' the wisp]]
